Description: A white plaster mould for an eagle-headed fish, probably one-piece, for an uncertain, but probably edible, product. The top edges are flat, without registration marks (not necessary with a one-piece mould). The back also is flat, with bevelled edges. Face varnished in modern times to release a cast.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3744)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Alan Henderson Gardiner
